oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Principles of Biological Control of Shipping Fever
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Wilkie, B. N.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Pasteurella haemolytica
bovine
immunization
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Using calves immunized with P. haemolytica serotype 1 and challenged by intrabronchial infusion of the homologous organism, the adverse effects of parenterally injected whole cell bacterins has been confirmed experimentally. Successful vaccination of calves to prevent Pasteurella-induced fibrinous pneumonia apparently cannot be accomplished by the simple expedient of parenteral injection of formalin killed bacterial cells.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; 1980; 113-114
